page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DOVER TOWN
page.content: HE HILLY NATURE OF DOVER DETERMINES MANY OF ITS CHARACTERISTICS.MOST OF THE RESIDENTIAL AREAS ARE IN VALLEYS AND EXIST ALMOST AS SEPERATE COMMUNITIES.WORKING CLASS AREAS SUCH AS ST.RADIGUNDS AND TOWER HAMLETS DIFFER GREATLY FROM THEIR NEAR NEIGHBOURS,RIVER AND ELMS VALE.THE FORMER COMPRISE MAILY VICTORIAN TERRACED HOUSES COMPARED TO THE LARGER SEMI-DETACHED PROPERTIES OF THE LATTER. ARABLE AND CATTLE FARMING IS OFTEN CLOSE TO THE RESIDENTIAL AREAS ALONG THE TOPS OF THE HILLS.NO LARGE INDUSTRIES EXIST APART FROM THE SMALL ENGINEERING AND PAPER WORKS.MUCH OF THE USTRIAL LAND IS USED IN CONJUCTION WITH FREIGHT FORWARDING CONNECTED WITH THE DOKS.SHOPPING FACILITIES ARE LIMITED TO THE HIGH ST.AREA. THERE ARE A LARGE NUMBER OF SMALL HOTELS AND BOARDING HOUSES.
